element.short: Defines behaviour and contraints on the ValueSet Expansion operation
element.definition: Resource to define constraints on the Expansion of a FHIR ValueSet.
The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Globally unique logical identifier for  expansion profile
element.definition: An absolute URL that is used to identify this expansion profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this expansion profile is (or will be) published.

element.short: Additional identifier for the expansion profile (e.g. an Object Identifier)
element.definition: Formal identifier that is used to identify this expansion profile when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

element.short: Logical identifier for this version of the expansion profile
element.definition: Used to identify this version of the expansion profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.
element.comments: There may be multiple resource versions of the expansion profile that have the same identifier.

element.short: Informal name for this expansion profile
element.definition: A free text natural language name for the expansion profile.
element.comments: The name is not expected to be unique. A name should be provided unless the expansion profile is a contained resource (e.g. an anonymous expansion profile in a FHIR profile). Most registries will require a name.

element.definition: The status of the expansion profile.
element.comments: Allows filtering of expansion instances that are appropriate (or not) for use.
element.requirements: Identify when/if the expansion profile should be used.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map.

element.short: If for testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: This expansion profile was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended for genuine production usage.
element.comments: Allows filtering of expansion instances that are appropriate (or not) for use.
element.requirements: This expansion profile was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the expansion profile.
element.comments: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the expansion profile.

element.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comments: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Name of an individual to contact
element.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the expansion profile.
element.comments: If there is no named individual, the telecom is for the organization as a whole.

element.short: Contact details for individual or publisher
element.definition: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.
The date that the expansion profile status was last changed. The date must change when the business version changes, if it does, and it must change if the status code changes.
element.comments: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the expansion profile. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions.
element.requirements: Need to know when an expansion profile was first legal for use or became withdrawn or replaced.

element.short: Human language description of the expansion profile
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the use of the expansion profile - reason for definition,  conditions of use, etc. The description may include a list of expected usages for the expansion profile and can also describe the approach taken to build the expansion profile.
element.comments: The description is not intended to describe the semantics of the expansion profile. The description should capture its intended use, which is needed for ensuring integrity for its use in models across future changes. A description should be provided unless the expansion profile is a contained resource (e.g. an anonymous expansion profile in a FHIR profile). Most registries will require a description.

element.short: When the expansion profile imposes code system contraints
element.definition: A set of criteria that provide the constraints imposed on the value set expansion by including or excluding codes from specific code systems (or versions).

constraint.human: SHALL NOT have include and exclude

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: The specific code system to be included
element.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system to be included.
element.comments: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be included.
element.comments: This is used to apply version specifc inclusion contraints. If no version is specified, then all codes from the code system present in the expansion (prior to application of the expansion profile) will be retained.

element.definition: Code systems to be excluded from value set expansions.

element.short: The specific code system to be excluded
element.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system to be excluded.
element.comments: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be excluded.
element.comments: This is used to apply version specifc exclusion contraints. If no version is specified, then all codes from the code system present in the expansion (prior to application of the expansion profile) will be excluded.

element.short: Whether the expansion should include concept designations
element.definition: Controls whether concept designations are to be included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are only evaluated if includeDesignations is present and set to "true". If includeDesignations is present with a value of "true" and both ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are absent, then all designations are returned in the expansion.

element.short: When the expansion profile imposes designation contraints
element.definition: A set of criteria that provide the constraints imposed on the value set expansion by including or excluding designations.

element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comments: In the absence of a language, all designations are retained which match the designation.use parameter for this include.designation.

element.definition: Designation uses for inclusion in the expansion.
element.comments: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this include.designation element.

element.short: Human language of the designation to be excluded
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comments: In the absence of a language, all designations are excluded which match the designation.use parameter for this exclude.designation element.

element.definition: Designation uses for exclusion in the expansion.
element.comments: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this exclude.designation element.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.short: Include or exclude the value set definition in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether the value set definition is included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: The ValueSet defintion refers to all fields in the ValueSet definition apart from  ValueSet.contains. The definition is only included if includeDefinition is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude inactive concepts in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether inactive concepts are included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: Inactive codes are included if includeInactive is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude nested codes in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes nested codes (i.e. ValueSet.expansion.contains.contains).
element.comments: Nested codes excluded if excludeNested is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude codes which cannot be rendered in user interfaces in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes codes which cannot be displayed in user interfaces.
element.comments: Codes which cannot be used in user interfaces will be excluded if excludeNotForUI is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude codes which are post coordinated expressions in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes post coordinated codes.
element.comments: Post coordinated codes are excluded if excludePostCoordinated is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Specify the language for the display element of codes in the value set expansion
element.definition: Specifies the language to be used for description in the expansions i.e. the language to be used for ValueSet.expansion.contains.display.

element.short: Controls behaviour of the value set expand operation when value sets are too large to be completely expanded
element.definition: If the value set being expanded is incomplete (because it is too big to expand), return a limited expansion (a subset) with an indicator that expansion is incomplete.
element.comments: This field overides the default behaviour (which is to return an error). This does not apply to expansions which are unbounded.

element.short: Defines behaviour and contraints on the ValueSet Expansion operation
element.definition: Resource to define constraints on the Expansion of a FHIR ValueSet.

element.short: Globally unique logical identifier for  expansion profile

element.short: Human language description of the expansion profile
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the use of the expansion profile - reason for definition,  conditions of use, etc. The description may include a list of expected usages for the expansion profile and can also describe the approach taken to build the expansion profile.
element.comments: The description is not intended to describe the semantics of the expansion profile. The description should capture its intended use, which is needed for ensuring integrity for its use in models across future changes. A description should be provided unless the expansion profile is a contained resource (e.g. an anonymous expansion profile in a FHIR profile). Most registries will require a description.

element.short: When the expansion profile imposes code system contraints
element.definition: A set of criteria that provide the constraints imposed on the value set expansion by including or excluding codes from specific code systems (or versions).

constraint.human: SHALL NOT have include and exclude

element.definition: Code systems to be included in value set expansions.

element.short: The code systems to be included
element.definition: A data group for each code system to be included.

element.short: The specific code system to be included
element.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system to be included.
element.comments: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be included.
element.comments: This is used to apply version specifc inclusion contraints. If no version is specified, then all codes from the code system present in the expansion (prior to application of the expansion profile) will be retained.

element.definition: Code systems to be excluded from value set expansions.

element.short: The code systems to be excluded
element.definition: A data group for each code system to be excluded.

element.short: The specific code system to be excluded
element.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system to be excluded.
element.comments: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be excluded.
element.comments: This is used to apply version specifc exclusion contraints. If no version is specified, then all codes from the code system present in the expansion (prior to application of the expansion profile) will be excluded.

element.short: Whether the expansion should include concept designations
element.definition: Controls whether concept designations are to be included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are only evaluated if includeDesignations is present and set to "true". If includeDesignations is present with a value of "true" and both ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are absent, then all designations are returned in the expansion.

element.short: When the expansion profile imposes designation contraints
element.definition: A set of criteria that provide the constraints imposed on the value set expansion by including or excluding designations.

constraint.human: SHALL NOT have include and exclude

element.definition: Designations to be included.
A data group for each designation to be included.
element.comments: At least one of designation.language or designation.use must be provided for each include.designation element.

constraint.human: SHALL have at least one of language or use

element.short: Human language of the designation to be included
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comments: In the absence of a language, all designations are retained which match the designation.use parameter for this include.designation.

element.definition: Designation uses for inclusion in the expansion.
element.comments: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this include.designation element.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.definition: Designations to be excluded.
A data group for each designation to be excluded.
element.comments: At least one of designation.language or designation.use must be provided for each exclude.designation element.

constraint.human: SHALL have at least one of language or use

element.short: Human language of the designation to be excluded
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comments: In the absence of a language, all designations are excluded which match the designation.use parameter for this exclude.designation element.

element.definition: Designation uses for exclusion in the expansion.
element.comments: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this exclude.designation element.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.short: Include or exclude the value set definition in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether the value set definition is included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: The ValueSet defintion refers to all fields in the ValueSet definition apart from  ValueSet.contains. The definition is only included if includeDefinition is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude inactive concepts in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether inactive concepts are included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comments: Inactive codes are included if includeInactive is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude nested codes in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes nested codes (i.e. ValueSet.expansion.contains.contains).
element.comments: Nested codes excluded if excludeNested is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude codes which cannot be rendered in user interfaces in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes codes which cannot be displayed in user interfaces.
element.comments: Codes which cannot be used in user interfaces will be excluded if excludeNotForUI is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude codes which are post coordinated expressions in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes post coordinated codes.
element.comments: Post coordinated codes are excluded if excludePostCoordinated is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Specify the language for the display element of codes in the value set expansion
element.definition: Specifies the language to be used for description in the expansions i.e. the language to be used for ValueSet.expansion.contains.display.

element.short: Controls behaviour of the value set expand operation when value sets are too large to be completely expanded
element.definition: If the value set being expanded is incomplete (because it is too big to expand), return a limited expansion (a subset) with an indicator that expansion is incomplete.
element.comments: This field overides the default behaviour (which is to return an error). This does not apply to expansions which are unbounded.
